Traverse City, MI 49686
Dear Mr. Cieslinski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
1/21/2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. This
agency is non-contracted and therefore not required to follow MISEP.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. This agency is non-contracted and therefore not required to
follow MDHHS contract/policy.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was provided technical assistance regarding timeframes and staff that are
required to complete Security Awareness Training.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit any corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA reported the adoption program continues to be small, with no immediate plans
for growth. The adoption staff remains the same and completes home studies as
needed. The CA did not report any concerns about this review period.
Interviews
The adoption staff was interviewed at the agency. He reported the program remains
small. The adoption worker indicated he works part time and completes home studies
when families inquire with a potential match in mind. The staff reported enjoying the
work and having no concerns about the agency.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
A field analyst review was not completed as this is a non-contracted, private adoption
agency.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
_ _______________January 24, 2022______________
Heather Reilly Date
